note: Content strategy for LinkedIn automation. Defines pillars, calendar, post structure, and style rules for all three accounts.

personal.purpose: Build professional brand, share journey, attract opportunities

pillars.name: Build in Public
pillars.description: Transparent sharing of what I'm building, decisions made, struggles encountered
content_types: Struggles and how I solved them
example_hooks: I've been stuck on this for 3 days.
Here's what I shipped this week.
I made a decision that changed everything.
This bug taught me something important.

pillars.name: Career Journey
pillars.description: Authentic sharing of career path, job search, education completion
example_hooks: I didn't take the traditional path.
Here's what 100 job applications taught me.
I finished my degree while working full-time.
This rejection changed my approach.

pillars.name: Technical Learning
pillars.description: Share what I'm learning, tools I'm testing, skills I'm developing
example_hooks: I finally understand how this works.
This tool changed my workflow.
I spent a week learning X. Here's the truth.
The docs don't tell you this.

pillars.name: Personal Stories
pillars.description: Authentic life experiences that shaped me as a developer and person. The human side of building.
content_types: Balancing work, side projects, and life
The human side of being a developer
example_hooks: I almost quit coding 6 months in. Here's what changed.
The worst job I ever had taught me the most.
I didn't start coding until I was [X]. Here's what I wish I knew.
This failure cost me 3 months. I'd do it again.
Everyone saw the launch. Nobody saw the 4am debugging sessions.
I used to think success meant X. Now I know better.

pillars.name: Build in Public
pillars.description: Transparent product development, revenue, decisions, failures, and lessons learned
example_hooks: Here's what we shipped this week.

pillars.name: Craftsmanship & Quality
pillars.description: Architecture decisions, code quality philosophy, testing approach, why we choose quality over speed
example_hooks: We spent 3 days on a feature users will never see.

pillars.name: AI-Assisted Building
pillars.description: How we use LLMs effectively, automation philosophy, practical AI workflows, honest takes on what works
content_types: Actual AI workflows we use daily
What AI is bad at (honest takes)
Tools we use: Claude Code, Cursor, Codex
example_hooks: I automated this. Here's why I wish I hadn't.

pillars.name: Security by Default
pillars.description: Security baked in from day one, not bolted on. Leverages founder's AppSec background.
content_types: How AppSec background shapes our code
Security vs speed tradeoffs we make
example_hooks: This is the first thing we build in every product.
A security decision that cost us a week. No regrets.
Why 'add auth later' is a trap.
The security check that saved us from a breach.
Most devs skip this. We don't.

pillars.name: Product Philosophy
pillars.description: Anti-VC, anti-dark-patterns, sustainable building. Why we build what we build, how we build.
content_types: Dark patterns we refuse to use
example_hooks: We don't do annual discounts. Here's why.
VC money would have killed this product.
What we say no to (and why it matters).

post_structure.note: Standard structure for LinkedIn posts. Automation should follow this format.

hook.description: Opening line that stops the scroll. Must be compelling and specific.
requirements: First line appears in feed preview, make it count
Avoid generic openings like 'I'm excited to share'
No questions as hooks (LinkedIn hides them)
examples: I've applied to 47 jobs in 30 days. Here's what actually works.
This one security check would have saved me 3 days of debugging.
I almost mass-deleted a production database yesterday.

body.description: Main content delivering value, story, or insight
requirements: Be specific with numbers, examples, or details

cta.description: Call to action, engagement prompt or next step
examples: What's one security check you always forget?
Save this for your next code review.

hashtags.placement: End of post, after line break

constraints.emoji_usage: Sparingly for emphasis, never as bullet points
forbidden: Em dashes (use commas or periods instead)
Engagement bait ('Comment YES if you agree')
